result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Menger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

AODA and follow up deemed appropriate. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Random testing. Submit to DNA analysis.
9/13/22 - Court grants Huber. Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

supervisions.notes: Court costs due during term of probation on count 1. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M Menger

records.addlTxt: No objection by DA to Huber request. Court orders JOC amended to include Huber.

8:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher M Menger appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Christopher M Menger. Counsel previously efiled waiver of preliminary hearing. Court examines Defendant, accepts said waiver, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.

Not to operate a motor vehicle. Absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

1:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher M Menger appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Christopher M Menger. Counsel waives reading. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $5000 cash bail w/conditions. Defendant on PO hold. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
